c74object.name: mvc.message
c74object.digest: Declare a message and its attributes
c74object.description: mvc.message declares a message in the aim namespace - it is somehow similar to the mvc.parameter object, except that it is state-less, that is, it has no memory and as such, it is not stored in preset and has no default value. For instance, a "clear" message to a filter could be represented as an mvc.message.
c74object.discussion:
An mvc.message object enable to define messages in a model (defined by an mvc.model) to which we'll be able to send data and consequently tweak a process. Since they are state-less, we can just send data to it or receive it, but not fetch it.
mvc.parameter helps defining a model in the MVC model used in the MVC package.

outlet.name: address outlet
outlet.description: Since mvc.message can declare multiple addresses thanks to the braces notation, this outlet provide the specific address for which we are receiving a value on the first outlet.

outlet.name: dump outlet
outlet.description: Messages and information in reply to various messages

objarg.name: parent-uid
objarg.digest: Parent node's UID to which this mvc.message is attached.
objarg.description:
The parent node can either be :
an mvc.device : in this case, one should provide the device name (which is its own UID).
an mvc.model : in this case, one should provide the model's UID (see mvc.model reference).

objarg.name: message-name
objarg.description: The message name should be a symbol (that is, it can contain spaces, as long as it is surrounded by quotes). Note that the use of slashes (like "cutoff/frequency") in the name is prohibited. Best to keep it short.

method.name: anything (on the left inlet)
method.description: The values will be sent to all addresses covered by the mvc.message namespace.

method.name: setvalue (on the left inlet)
method.digest: Set the value of a specific address in the mvc.message namespace.
method.description: The values will be sent to the addresses of the mvc.message at the specified index (following the setvalue method in MC components).

method.name: name (on the right inlet)
method.description: Multiple message addresses can be set with the brace expansion notation.

method.name: parent (on the right inlet)
method.digest: UNSUPPORTED. Set the model to which this message is attached.

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: The default attribute sets the value to output at the leftmost outlet on model initialization. The default value can be overridden by the default model preset

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The description attribute allows to agive a textual description for this node. This helps documenting the message and can be retrieved by GUI elements (e.g. mvc.GUI.number).

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: The max attribute defines the maximum value of expected range of possible values. Depending on the clip attribute, this might be a recommended or mandatory range.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: The min attribute defines the minimum value of expected range of possible values. Depending on the clip attribute, this might be a recommended or mandatory range.

attribute.name: type
attribute.digest: Value type (integer, decimal, string, bool, list)
attribute.description:
The type attribute defines the type of the value. Possible types are:
decimal (default): a floating point value.
integer : an integer value.
string : a string value (aka "symbol" in Max).
bool : boolean value. Implicitely clips value to 0/1
list : a list of elements including numbers and symbols
dict : a dictionary

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit attribute defines the unit used by this message. It can be retrieved and displayed by GUI (and could possibly allow for dynamic unit conversion in the future).

attribute.name: range
attribute.description: The range attribute defines the expected range of possible values. Depending on the clip attribute, this might be a recommended or mandatory range.
